Indian Economy.title: Hard money: RBI must enlarge its buffer of foreign exchange reserves
Indian Economy.summary: Today’s level doesn’t look adequate in the context of risks arising from capital flows more than trade gaps. Look at India’s international investment position, not just import cover and current account deficit.

Indian Economy.title: India Ratings & Research trims India's FY26 GDP growth forecast to 6.3%
Indian Economy.summary: Ind-Ra predicts 6.3% GDP growth in FY26, citing global uncertainties and weak investment climate as major challenges.

Indian Economy.title: Mint Quick Edit | India’s economy is resilient in the face of headwinds
Indian Economy.summary: The Reserve Bank of India’s latest report on the economy makes for a reassuring read. Given the trade uncertainty that prevails, though, the real test may lie ahead.

Indian Economy.title: Indian economy remains largely resilient despite global uncertainties: RBI bulletin
Indian Economy.summary: Resilient Indian economy faces global uncertainties with strong fundamentals, easing inflation, and steady demand conditions, per RBI bulletin.

Indian Economy.title: ADB, Ind-Ra cut India’s growth forecast for FY26
Indian Economy.summary: While ADB’s forecast is at par with RBI’s projection of 6.5% and within the range of the Economic Survey’s estimates of 6.3 to 6.8%, Ind-Ra’s projection is lower than RBI’s forecast

Stock Market.title: Nifty breaks above 20-day EMA on trade deal optimism, closes 0.63% higher; Sensex rises 539 points
Stock Market.summary: Markets rebounded strongly with Nifty 50 closing above 20-day EMA, driven by global trade optimism and sectoral strength.

Stock Market.title: Nifty Prediction Today – July 23, 2025: Nifty 50 July Futures: Can rise from here. Go long
Stock Market.summary: Nifty 50 trading stable with positive bias, supports at 25,080 & 25,045, resistance at 25,250-25,300, trade strategy included.

Stock Market.title: Nifty Bank Prediction today – Jul 23, 2025: Intraday trend uncertain
Stock Market.summary: Nifty Bank index trading update with top gainers and losers, futures analysis, and trading strategy for Jul expiry.

Stock Market.title: Nifty, Sensex open with gains on US-Japan trade deal optimism, Experts see potential for rally
Stock Market.summary: The Nifty 50 index opened at 25,138.50, registering a gain of 77.60 points or 0.31 per cent. Similarly, the BSE Sensex began the day on a stronger note at 82,429.66, rising by 242.85 points or 0.30 per cent

Startups & Funding.summary: (under embargo till 23 July 2025, 12 PM)The funding will be deployed to enhance sales velocity, product innovation and deepen market presence across key verticals, globally

Startups & Funding.title: B2B AI firm Gupshup secures $60 million in fresh funding, eyes IPO in 12–24 months
Startups & Funding.summary: AI-powered messaging firm Gupshup raises $60 million in fresh equity and debt as it prepares for an IPO. CEO Beerud Sheth says India is a likely market for listing.

Startups & Funding.title: India’s manufacturing bet draws millions as sector-focused funds surge
Startups & Funding.summary: From semiconductors to defence, a new wave of private capital is targeting India’s industrial ambitions, testing whether policy and global tailwinds can translate into scale and returns.

Startups & Funding.title: Inbound Aerospace raises $1 million pre-seed funding to build autonomous re-entry spacecraft
Startups & Funding.summary: The fresh capital is set to be used to accelerate the R&D of its re-entry spacecraft, validate key sub-systems and achieve critical design review milestones

Startups & Funding.summary: Bombay Shaving's CEO Shantanu Deshpande, in a social media post, predicted that the premium skincare brand, Minimalist, will ‘die’ or cease to exist in the next three to five years. This comes months after HUL got CCI approval to acquire over 90% stake in Min…

Banking & Finance.title: The cost of credit isn’t everything: Cheap loans need productive uses
Banking & Finance.summary: India’s banking system is flush with liquidity amid weak demand for loans that go into value generation. This could spell larger risks than RBI’s monetary policy may have pencilled in.

Banking & Finance.title: RBI conducts surprise VRR auction for ₹50,000 cr to infuse liquidity in banking system
Banking & Finance.summary: Banks bid ₹71,902 crore against ₹50,000 crore, RBI accepts ₹50,001 crore bids at 5.58% rate, addressing liquidity concerns.

Banking & Finance.title: RBI cancels Karnataka-based Karwar Urban Co-operative Bank's licence over earnings prospect
Banking & Finance.summary: Reserve Bank of India (RBI), on 23 July 2025, cancelled the licence of the Karnataka-based Karwar Urban Co-operative Bank due to the institutional lender's lack of earning prospects over a matter of public interest. Check how much depositors will get back.&nb…

Technology Sector.title: Infosys’s strong showing not enough to power Indian IT in slow first quarter
Technology Sector.summary: Infosys has emerged as the fastest-growing Indian IT services company, significantly exceeding analysts' expectations with its latest quarterly results. But while Infosys is optimistic about its growth this year, the IT services sector remains wary of persist…

Technology Sector.title: Top IT companies’ deal wins rise 17% in Q1 led by larger deals
Technology Sector.summary: Top Indian IT companies see $21 billion in deal wins in Q2, led by large deals, hinting at changing trends.

Technology Sector.title: Businesses must adopt internal carbon pricing before they’re forced to
Technology Sector.summary: Climate risks are turning into financial risks but India Inc seems mostly ill-prepared for a carbon market on its way. Compressing the cost of greenhouse gas emissions could decide whether a business thrives or gets left behind.

Technology Sector.title: PM leads top Indian CEOs to the UK with prep on for FTA signing
Technology Sector.summary: Top Indian business leaders join PM Modi on UK trip to discuss India-UK FTA and economic partnership opportunities.

Technology Sector.title: India’s National Education Policy has been a victim of ignorance
Technology Sector.summary: The 2020 policy’s proposals are misrepresented so often that one wonders if its critics have actually read it. Like the Constitution, it often gets unfairly blamed for our own failures.
